hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout with Regime Confirmation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 10-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day realized volatility by more than 15% (compression) during a NEUTRAL regime, and the 2-day RSI crosses above 50 within 3 days of compression, a volatility expansion move will occur with BTC price moving >5% in the direction of the RSI cross within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression during neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. The RSI cross provides timing confirmation while the regime filter avoids false breakouts during trending markets. Current news about volatility management suggests traders are positioned for expansion.
entry_conditions: BTC 2-day RSI crosses above 50 within 3 days of volatility compression signal

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% price move from entry in direction of trade

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of signals result in <3% price movement within 5 days OR compression periods extend beyond 5 days without expansion.
